module.name: sqldb
module.short: A set of classes for connection to SQL databases and interchanging information with them

element.name: TSQLConnection
element.short: TSQLConnection - a class for making a connection to a SQL Database
element.descr: TSQLConnection - a class for making a connection to a SQL Database Performs most of the housekeeping necessary for user authentication, connection to the database and ensuring that it is ready for data processing.

element.name: TSQLConnection.Handle
element.short: Handle - a pointer to the database provided by the operating system

element.name: TSQLConnection.Destroy
element.short: Destroys the instance of the component.
element.descr: Destroy sends a opRemove notification to all components in the free-notification list. After that, all owned components are destroyed by calling DestroyComponents (and hence removed from the list of owned components). When this is done, the component removes itself from its owner's child component list. After that, the parent's destroy method is called.

element.name: TSQLConnection.StartTransaction
element.short: Start the Transaction associated with this Connection

element.name: TSQLConnection.EndTransaction
element.short: End the Transaction associated with this connection

element.name: TSQLConnection.ConnOptions
element.short: The set of Connection Options being used in thei Connection

element.name: TSQLConnection.ExecuteDirect
element.short: Execute a piece of SQL code directly, using a Transaction if specified

element.name: TSQLConnection.GetTableNames
element.short: Get a list of the tables in the specified database

element.name: TSQLConnection.GetProcedureNames
element.short: Gets a list of Stored Procedures in the Database

element.name: TSQLConnection.GetFieldNames
element.short: Gets a list of the field names in the specified table

element.name: TSQLConnection.CreateDB
element.short: Procedure to Create a new Database (like SQL: CREATE DATABASE)

element.name: TSQLConnection.DropDB
element.short: Procedure to drop or remove a Database (Like SQL: DROP DATABASE)

element.name: TSQLConnection.Password
element.short: Password - for authentication of username in connection to the database

descr.p: Password - for authentication of username in connection to the database

This property can be pre-set in the object Inspector, but in that case it would be visible to anyone looking over the designer's shoulder. It is safer to use a login dialog in which the password is typed into a masked edit field, or alternatively to retrieve the password by code from an encrypted file

element.name: TSQLConnection.Transaction
element.short: A SQL Transaction class the be used in conjunction with this connection

element.name: TSQLConnection.UserName
element.short: The User Name for authentication of the connection to the database

descr.p: The User Name for authentication of the connection to the database
This property can be pre-set in the Object Inspector, which can be useful during testing of programs, but for operational use it should preferably be filled by using a log-in dialog.

element.name: TSQLConnection.CharSet
element.short: The Charavter Set to be used in this database connection

element.name: TSQLConnection.HostName
element.short: The name of the Host Computer where the SQL server or client is resident and to which connection is to be made

descr.p: The name of the Host Computer where the SQL server or client is resident and to which connection is to be made

This property can be pre-set in the Object Inspector during programme testing or if the programme is always going to run on the same machine, but more usually and more usefully would be set in a log-in dialog along with the UserName and Password.

element.name: TSQLConnection.Connected
element.short: Connected - this property can be set provided all authentication is correct and the connection can be opened properly

element.name: TSQLConnection.DatabaseName
element.short: DatabaseName - the name of the database to which connection is required

descr.p: DatabaseName - the name of the database to which connection is required

This property MUST be set before connection can be made. If you do not know the name of the specific database required, then insert the name of a database that is known always to be present (example: 'mysql', the housekeeping database in MySQL installations)

element.name: TSQLConnection.KeepConnection
element.short: KeepConnection - keep the connection open once it is established and the first query has been executed

element.name: TSQLConnection.LoginPrompt
element.short: The prompt to be given if a login dialog is used

element.name: TSQLConnection.OnLogin
element.short: Event handler for login process
